name: Lateral-to-Front Raises
how_to_perform:
1. Start with a dumbbell in each hand, standing with your feet shoulder-width apart.

2. Bend your knees slightly and hinge forward from the hips to lift the weights out of your body.

3. Hold one weight at the sides (laterally) while letting the other weight hang down along the front of your leg.

4. Keeping your core engaged and back straight, contract the muscle on the side with the raised weight and raise it to a position in line with your shoulder.

5. Pause briefly and then slowly lower it back down to the start.

6. Repeat with the opposite arm (alternate sides).

7. Continue alternating arms for the desired number of repetitions.
short_summary: Lateral-to-Front Raises are an isolation exercise working primarily the middle deltoids, focusing on precision-controlled lateral movements and forward elevations using dumbbells.
